{"step_by_step_thinking": "When resin is packed in sandy stage, it refers to the stage where the resin is not fully mixed and has a sandy texture. In this case, the resin may not polymerize properly and may result in incomplete curing. This can lead to porosity in the processed denture, as the resin may not fully fill the mold and create voids or air pockets. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Porosity.", "answer_choice": "B"}
